page.title: 08Blakedown Railway Station
page.content: {Blakedown Railway}station is on the {Hereford to Birmingham}line. It has an old signal box and a level crossing. In 1982 the manually operated crossing was replaced by an automatic system. You go through a white gate onto the platform and wait in a steel waiting room with bench seats. Trains run from 7.08 am approximately every hour until 23.42 pm. Trains are more frequent at commuter times taking workers into Birmingham (journey time = 41 minutes) in the mornings and returning in the evenings. There is a small car park for the use of commuters. A sign by the railway informs you that the penalty for trespassing on the railway is Â£2 or 3 months in prison.
